text:
Hello! its me again, I'm now running into a string comparison issue, essentially my package is reading text from a document and I have typed the expected string as part of the text, problem is that the text read has different codepoints which makes the comparison yield inequality, here's an excerpt of the test evaluations:

```  Expression: result[i] == expected[i]
   Evaluated: ' ' == ' '
  Expression: codepoint(result[i]) == codepoint(expected[i])
   Evaluated: 0x000000a0 == 0x00000020```
As you can see the strings/chars "are the same" yet they have different code points, is there a function that "normalizes" this sort of thing?

elements.text: Hello! its me again, I'm now running into a string comparison issue, essentially my package is reading text from a document and I have typed the expected string as part of the text, problem is that the text read has different codepoints which makes the comparison yield inequality, here's an excerpt of the test evaluations:

Expression: result[i] == expected[i]
   Evaluated: ' ' == ' '
  Expression: codepoint(result[i]) == codepoint(expected[i])
   Evaluated: 0x000000a0 == 0x00000020
As you can see the strings/chars "are the same" yet they have different code points, is there a function that "normalizes" this sort of thing?

text: Is that only happening for those characters?

elements.text: Is that only happening for those characters?

text: Could you do a replace of all instances of space (U+0020) with No-Break Space (U+00A0)?

elements.text: Could you do a replace of all instances of space (U+0020) with No-Break Space (U+00A0)?

text:
Thank you for your reply! not sure if its the only characters, I'll try what you suggested and see if there are any other similar issues.

The No-Break space is coming from what I typed in VSCode.

text: The "breaking" space came from copy-pasting the lorem ipsum sample from here: <https://lipsum.com>
